snippet: Upholding a decision issued last month, a federal judge said the government cannot indefinitely detain anyone suspected of terrorism on American soil.
abstract: Federal Judge Katherine B Forrest clarifies her injunction barring the government from holding people in indefinite military detention under the provisions of a disputed 2011 law; Forrest notes that the injunction, which the government had interpreted narrowly, applies to all detainees.
lead_paragraph: Upholding a decision issued last month, a federal judge said the government cannot indefinitely detain anyone suspected of terrorism on American soil.
